N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5400.2 - Appeals of denial of access to records

State Regulations
(a) Any person who has been denied access to
records by the records access officer may appeal such denial to the records
access appeals officer. (b) The
appeal must be made within 30 days of the denial of access, as required by

Public Officers Law section 89(4)(a). (c) The time for deciding on an appeal by the
records access appeals officer shall commence upon receipt by the records
access appeals officer of the written appeal, which shall identify: (1)
the date and location of requests made
for records; (2)
the records to
which the applicant was denied access; and
(3)
the name and return address of the
applicant. (d) The
records access appeals officer shall, within 10 business days of the receipt of
a written appeal, review the matter and affirm, modify or reverse the denial, as required by Public Officers Law section 89(4)(a). (e) If the records access appeals officer
determines that the denial of access was erroneous, the records access appeals
officer shall instruct the records access officer to allow the prompt
inspection or copying of the records as requested. (f) If the records access appeals officer
affirms or modifies the denial, the records access appeals officer shall
communicate his or her reasons in writing by either first class mail or
electronic mail, if the person making the appeal has provided an electronic
mail address, to the person making the appeal and inform such person of such
person's right of judicial appeal. Notes
